{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode = baseball |Year = 2010 |Team = Kansas State Wildcats |Image = Kstate text logo.svg |ImageSize = 200 |Conference = Big 12 Conference |Division = |ShortConference = Big 12 |CoachRank = RV |AP = RV |Record = 37-22 |ConfRecord = 14-12 |HeadCoach = [[Brad Hill (baseball coach)|Brad Hill]] |HitCoach = Andy Sawyers |PitchCoach = Sean McCann |StadiumArena = [[Tointon Family Stadium]] |Champion = |BowlTourney = [[2010 NCAA Division I Baseball Tournament|2010 NCAA Tournament Participant]] |BowlTourneyResult = }} {{2010 Big 12 Baseball Standings}} The '''2010 Kansas State Wildcats baseball team''' represents [[Kansas State University]] in the [[NCAA]] [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] [[college baseball]] [[2010 NCAA Division I baseball season|season of 2010]]. It is the 110th baseball season in school history.[http://www.kstatesports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=400&ATCLID=3659522 Season preview] The team's head coach is [[Brad Hill (baseball coach)|Brad Hill]] who is in his seventh season at Kansas State. He was previously the head coach at [[Central Missouri State University|Central Missouri State]] before coming to [[Manhattan, Kansas|Manhattan]] in 2004. ==Season== ===Regular Season=== {{Empty section|date=January 2011}} ===Conference Tournament=== {{Empty section|date=January 2011}} ===NCAA Tournament=== {{Empty section|date=January 2011}} ==Roster== {| class="toccolours" style="border-collapse:collapse; |- |} [http://www.kstatesports.com/SportSelect.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=400&KEY=&SPID=222&SPSID=3230 2010 Schedule] ==Awards and honors== Sophomore outfielder Nick Martini was named the league's co-Player of the Year, the first time a Wildcat had received the honor since [[Craig Wilson (third baseman, born 1970)|Craig Wilson]] in 1992. It was K-State's third specialty award in the past two years after A.J. Morris was named Pitcher of the Year and [[Brad Hill (baseball)|Brad Hill]] as Coach of the Year in 2009. Martini shared the Player of the Year award with Missouri's Aaron Seene. Martini was one of three Wildcats to earn first-team All-Big 12 honors as he was joined on the squad by senior third baseman Adam Muenster and junior shortstop Carter Jurica. It was the most first-team members for Kansas State since the Wildcats placed three on the All-Big Eight team in 1995 Sophomore pitcher Evan Marshall was named to the second team. He has been stellar for the Wildcats since making a switch from starter to reliever midway through the season. Marshall is 5-3 with a 3.76 ERA this season, but holds a 1.82 ERA in 17 relief appearances since moving to the bullpen. In 34 2/3 innings as a relief pitcher, Marshall is limiting opponents to a .165 batting average, including a .162 mark in Big 12 play. Senior catcher Daniel Dellasega and sophomore pitcher Kyle Hunter were named honorable mention All-Big 12. Coupled with the seven All-Big 12 honorees last season, the 13 Wildcats to earn All-Big 12 honors over the last two seasons are the most in a two-year span since 2001-02.[http://www.kstatesports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?SPSID=3226&SPID=222&DB_OEM_ID=400&ATCLID=204950823 Big 12 awards] ==Wildcats in the 2010 MLB Draft== The following members of the 2010 Kansas State Wildcats baseball team were drafted in the [[2010 Major League Baseball Draft|2010 MLB Draft]]. {| border="0" width="100%" | valign="top" | {| cellpadding="1" border="1" cellspacing="0" width="76%" !bgcolor="#800080" width="20%"| Player !bgcolor="#800080" width="12%"| Position !bgcolor="#800080" width="12%"| Round !bgcolor="#800080" width="12%"| Overall !bgcolor="#800080" width="20%"| MLB Team |- align="center" | Carter Jurica | Short Stop | 3rd | 105 | [[San Francisco Giants]] |- align="center" | Mason Justice* | Pitcher | 21st | 653 | [[Boston Red Sox]] |- align="center" | Adam Muenster | Third Base | 29th | 907 | [[Cincinnati Reds]] |- align="center" | Johnny Fasola* | Pitcher | 36th | 1,102 | [[Los Angeles Dodgers]] |- align="center" | Levi Schlick* | Pitcher | 39th | 1,178 | [[Chicago White Sox]] |- align="center" | Kyle Hunter | Pitcher | 43rd | 1,315 | [[New York Yankees]] |- align="center" | Blake Freeman* | Pitcher | 45th | 1,361 | [[Tampa Bay Rays]] |}
